properties.name: 1913 Room
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 187 Monroe Ave. NW Grand Rapids, MI 49503Located in the Amway Grand Hotel, the 1913 Room is Michigan\'s only 5-diamond restaurant.

properties.name: Alpenrose Restaurant & Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  4 E. Eighth St. Holland, MI 49424Traditional German specialities in a beautiful setting. The Alpenrose is not just a restaurant. It\'s an idea: to bring an authentic taste of the Alps to downtown Holland. To the average passerby, "the Alps" probably sparks visions of lederhosen and oompah bands, but the famed European mountain range actually carves through countries as diverse as Austria, Germany, France, Italy, Switzerland--a cornucopia of cultures and cuisines which can all claim the title "Alpen." Years before our 1991 opening, many of us who were involved in developing this idea called Alpenrose, began cultivating an ever-deepening affinity for the people and places of the region. We hope that our on-going love affair is reflected, not only in the food we prepare and the service we deliver, but throughout the Alpenrose facility itself.  Entering the Alpenrose, it\'s hard to image that this building once housed a run-of-the-mill discount store. The Alpenrose is wall-to-wall wood, even support columns and ceiling rafters display exquisite wooden carvings of the Alpenrose--a rhododendron type flower found throughout the Alps. Our dream of bringing Alpen charm to West Michigan is reflected in our multiple dining rooms as well. From our family-oriented Kitzbuhel ski lodge to the classical, fine-dining elegance of our Salzburg room to the tasteful banquets available in the Garmisch room,  Alpenrose is a magnificent microcosm of the many dining experiences available in the Alpen region.

properties.name: Amway Grand Plaza Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  187 Monroe Ave. NW Grand Rapids, MI 49503The Amway Grand Plaza, where every stay is marked by a memorable moment. Whether it\'s a stroll through the Pantlind Lobby, the great view from one of our Glass Tower rooms, the classical architecture, or your first bite of the Forbidden Apple at The 1913 Room.

properties.name: Book Nook & Java Shop
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks   8726 Ferry St. Montague, MI 49437. (231) 894-5333.The Book Nook & Java Shop is located in a small community along the Lake Michigan shoreline. Despite the small size of the store and community, we have established a great reputation for good turnouts at author events and a great reputation with our patrons for the fun and excitement our events provide. The store has hosted Garrison Keillor (selling more than 3000 copies) and Robert Kurson (Shadow Divers). Sue Ellen Cooper (Red Hat Society) drew over 700 ladies in red hats and purple dresses selling 300 copies! It also hosts live music on the weekends and our wireless cafe makes it a magnet for the community.

properties.name: Charley's Crab
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 63 Market Ave SW, Grand Rapids, 49503Charley\'s Crab is located in downtown Grand Rapids on the former site of the Grand Rapids Ice Company overlooking the Grand River. The restaurant has many features that give tribute to the local businesses of Grand Rapids. Adorning the walls of the restaurant are 56 names of the original founding local businesses. Along with these names is a huge mural by Jeff Jefferies, depicting historical scenes from early Grand Rapids and its industry. Towering from the ceiling are carved redwood beams from the famous Macauley mansion in Grosse Pointe, Michigan. Mr. Macauley was the president of Packwood Motors & Burroughs Corporation located in Detroit.

properties.name: Country Inns & Suites
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks12260 James St. Holland, MI 49424The Country Inn-Holland Michigan, combines business professionalism with friendly service, a clean comfortable environment, inviting accommodations, expanded complimentary breakfast and value enhanced rates. It\'s all about the little things we do in the country. A warm smile and friendly hello, followed by a call to make sure you are just as cozy as home. You\'ll feel the country charm throughout...the lobby fireplace, the aroma of fresh backed cookies or a warm welcome from our entire staff. We are now also offering you complimentary High-Speed Wireless Internet, available in all guest rooms and throughout the entire hotel. The Country Inn-Holland a cozy stay at a comfortable price.

properties.name: Courtyard by Marriott
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 333 East Jefferson Ave. Detroit, MI 48226The Courtyard by Marriott Detroit Downtown is a sleek, stylish star among Detroit hotels - offering the superior convenience along with the Courtyard amenities and services you rely on to make your trips successful.

properties.name: Courtyard by Marriott
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks11 Monroe Ave. NW Grand Rapids, MI Situated in the heart of downtown Grand Rapids, the Downtown Courtyard by Marriott is connected by skywalk to Van Andel Arena as well as DeVos Hall.

properties.name: Courtyard by Marriott Highland Park
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 1505 Lake Cook Rd, Highland Park, ILNearby North Shore accommodation. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, you\'ll have easy access to downtown Chicago as well as area businesses and attractions. Our 149 guest rooms feature the new Marriott bed designed to make your stay both productive and comfortable--with free high-speed Internet access and complimentary coffee. Begin your day at the Courtyard Cafe and enjoy our full, hot breakfast buffet, featuring cooked-to-order eggs. Relax in our indoor pool or whirlpool and visit area attractions such as the Chicago Botanic Garden and Ravinia Festival. The Courtyard Chicago Highland Park/Northbrook also offers two meeting rooms, making it an ideal location for small meetings and catered events.

properties.name: Curragh Irish Pub
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 73 East Eighth St. Holland, MI 49423Hearty Irish fare. We wanted our name to tell a lot about our pub. The Curragh is headquarters of Flat Racing in Ireland. Written evidence of racing dates back to the third century when chariot races were held at the “Cuireach" — the Gaelic word for racecourse — on the lands known today as the Curragh Racecourse and Training Grounds. The Curragh hosts all five Classic Races and up to thirteen other quality race days annually. It is owned by the Irish Turf Club, founded in Kildare in the 1760\'s.

Ideal location coupled with fabulous amenities, surrounds travelers with the conveniences that make business and pleasure travel easy. We are well equipped to accommodate all your needs from corporate meetings to private parties.

properties.name: Dutch Colonial Inn
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 560 Central Ave. Holland, MI 49423Bed and Breakfast, residential area, 1 mile from downtown Holland. The Dutch Colonial Inn Bed and Breakfast originated as a family residence. The initial structure, built in 1928, served as a wedding gift for the bride and groom. Now, over 70 years later, we offer several of our suites as honeymoon suites and special romantic getaways. The Dutch Colonial Inn Bed and Breakfast is located in the charming Midwest town of Holland, MI. Holland is well known for its annual Tulip Festival, Snowmelt, over 150 special shops, and features the only Delftware factory in the USA. With beautiful beaches along the Lake Michigan shoreline, autumn colors and December\'s Winter Fest Celebration, you can enjoy Holland year-round.

properties.name: Egg Harbor Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  512 N. Western Ave. Lake Forest, IL 60045Local breakfast and lunch restaurant. Once upon a time our founders had a dream; they dreamed of a special cafe where quality, cleanliness and great service would be the rule...not the exception. A place where every visitor would be treated as a special guest. Well...that dream came true. Egg Harbor Cafe hatched in December 1985. Our pledge to you has been and always will be: To provide you with the highest quality ingredients and friendly, efficient service; and most importantly that our owners and staff will always strive to see that this promise remains a reality. Thank you for letting us be a part of your day!

properties.name: Fishbone's
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 400 Monroe St, Detroit, 48226Fishbone\'s GFishbone\'s Greektown is a "hot spot" for locals and visitors alike. This up-scale seafood, steak and sushi house boasts an extensive menu of Creole and classic American fare, including prime steaks and chops, fresh fish, pastas and daily specials. This Motown destination features two sprawling bars, multi level seating, an open kitchen and huge shuttered windows.

Lake Forest, IL 60045Francesca\'s Intimo opened in early 2001 and is the 11th restaurant in "The Family of Francesca Restaurants," bringing downtown Lake Forest a restaurant with a contemporary, casually sophisticated trattoria ambiance, good, rustic cooking, friendly service and fair prices.

properties.name: Hampton Inn
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 12427 Felch St. Holland, MI 49424The Hampton Inn Holland hotel in Michigan is conveniently located off US-31 at Felch Street, a block north of Westshore Mall. In the Holland area, attractions include Dutch Village, Veldheer Tulip Gardens, and Windmill Island a short distance away. Lake Michigan and area beaches are a few miles from the Hampton Inn Holland hotel. Enjoy our Michigan hospitality and dine at Johnny Carinos, Logans Roadhouse, Ruby Tuesdays and many more restaurants, all within .1 mile of this Hampton Inn hotel. The Hampton Inn Holland hotel in Michigan features a 4-story, Victorian-style building with 178 rooms, outdoor patio with pool, ping-pong, pool tables, a great selection of the latest video games, and an adults only outdoor hot tub open year round until midnight. Sharkee\'s Poolside lounge is open 6 nights and offers a full service bar and variety of appetizers. The Hampton Inn Holland hotel in Michigan features extended stay suites and private rooms with whirlpool. Amenities of the hotel include complimentary deluxe continental breakfast, and USA Today, local calls, coffeemakers, iron and ironing board, TV with HBO, Disney, and ESPN. We also offer connecting rooms, cribs and rollaway beds at the Hampton Inn Holland hotel for a minimal fee. The Hampton Inn Holland hotel in Michigan offers a fantastic staff and a selection of rooms for business and leisure. All of our guest rooms offer cordless, 2-line phones, with wireless internet throughout the hotel. Guests love our big indoor pool, our on site lounge with high-speed internet access and cool game room for kids. We love having you here at the Hampton Inn Holland hotel in Michigan.

properties.name: Haworth Inn and Conference Center
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 225 College Ave. Holland, MI 49423Located downtown Holland, 2 blocks from main street. In 1994, feeling there was both a need and an opportunity to enhance their relationship with the Holland community, Hope College began working on plans for a hotel and conference center. These plans, soon fueled by a generous combined corporate/family donation to the "Hope in the Future" campaign from Haworth Inc. and the Haworth Family, began to take shape as the Haworth Inn and Conference Center at Hope College. Opening its doors to business on January 13, 1997, the Haworth Inn and Conference Center has fifty guest rooms and twelve conference rooms covering more than 10,000 square feet. Groups up to 350 can be accommodated in the conference rooms, while the hotel can house up to 172 people. Since its opening, the Haworth Inn and Conference Center has attracted state and regional associations, and has hosted everything from week long business conferences to a luncheon for Princess Margriet of the Netherlands, Hope College Alumni gatherings, Tulip Time visitors, family reunions and more.

properties.name: Lake Forest Book Store
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 680 North Western Ave. Lake Forest, IL 60045. (847) 234-4420.Lake Forest Book Store was opened in 1949 by a group of local women who decided that the small North Shore community needed a book store. For 55 years the book store inhabited 1000 square feet just south of the town square. Two years ago Lake Forest Book Store moved into the cornerstone space vacated by B. Dalton on historic Market Square, a downtown shopping area that was completed in 1917. Now located directly across from the Lake Forest train station the store is right in the middle of the town square area and has grown to 1800 square feet selling space. The book store is a general full service store with strong links to the community. We have partnerships with many local organizations and join together with them for many author and book events.

properties.name: Lake Forest Food and Wine Specialties
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  672 N. Western Ave. Lake Forest, IL 60045Lake Forest Food & Wine has been a Lake Forest destination for over 35 years. This European oasis offers a gourmet selection of cheeses, specialty foods, and over 400 wines sure to please every palate. Also a great lunch stop, the store features scrumptious hand tossed, made to order salads, and a fabulous selection of gourmet sandwiches on San Francisco\'s Boudin sourdough bread.

Comfortable style and gracious hospitality have become trademarks over our long history. Whether you choose to be active and make use of the recreational facilities or find a comfortable lawn chair and sit in the shade of friendly trees, the Lodge will satisfy your interests!

properties.name: River Bank Books & Music
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 86 Monroe Center NW Grand Rapids, MI 49503. (616) 451-4900.River Bank Books & Music is located in the heart of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan\'s second largest metropolitan area, with a population of over a million and a revitalized downtown. The store opened its doors on December 10, 2006, and has nearly 10,000 square feet of space. An additional 2,500 square feet will be added in the next few months for college text book sales. In addition to books and music, the store has a busy cafe and performance space, where we\'re expanding on the successful experience we gained in our first location, The Book Nook & Java Shop.

properties.name: San Chez, A Tapas Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  38 W. Fulton St. Grand Rapids, MI 49503Upscale food, big city atmosphere, casual attire. Cuisine of Spain. Specializing in Tapas, Sangria, Sherries, Ports and a wonderful wine list.

properties.name: Seldom Blues
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  400 Renaissance Center Detroit, MI 48243Detroit’s premier jazz restaurant and supper club, overlooking the Detroit River, offers a unique downtown dining and entertainment experience in the prestigious GM Renaissance Center. A cutting-edge, contemporary menu featuring continental cuisine with a French flair. From a magnificent Sunday Brunch, to a signature lunch and unforgettable dinner, Seldom Blues has changed the Detroit dining landscape forever.

properties.name: Shrine of the Black Madonna
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 13535 Livernois Ave. Detroit, MI 48238. (313) 491-0777.In 1970, the Shrine of the Black Madonna Cultural Center & Bookstore ("The Shrine") first opened its doors with the goal of showcasing the creative talents of artists & authors of African descent and empowering people through educational workshops & cultural events. The Shrine is one of the nation\'s largest & oldest black-owned bookstores, with locations in Detroit, Atlanta & Houston. Our locations range in size from 5,000 sq. ft to 20,000 sq. feet of retail space. Whether looking for classics, children\'s books, or the latest titles, visitors can find it at the Shrine. The Shrine Bookstore is a landmark cultural institution which not only contains over 17,000 titles related to the Black experience, but also carries quality art, artifacts, jewelry, apparel, home decor, and music. As a consistent winner of "Best Afro-centric Bookstore" in each of our cities, we bring the best of the African Diaspora to the community.

properties.name: Southgate Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks  655 Forest Ave. Lake Forest, IL 60045It really doesn\'t matter what the occasion is, South Gate Cafe in Lake Forest is a perfect place for a casual meal, or just a bowl of soup. Their sun-room overlooks their patio with a view of Market Square. It\'s nice to sit in the sun this time of year and enjoy one of their unique salads or just a sandwich. If you are really hungry, South Gate also has some unique, but tasty entries, too. The mussels are outstanding.

properties.name: Sweet Georgia Brown's
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 1045 Brush St. Detroit, MI 48226Detroit’s Sweet Georgia Brown is an extremely fine, upscale, American restaurant, with an eclectic and creative menu.

properties.name: The B.O.B.
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 20 Monroe Ave. NW Grand Rapids, MI 49503A multi-faceted entertainment center and restaurant complex featuring five restaurants, a micro-brewery, night club and comedy club.

properties.name: The Grille on Laurel
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 181 E. Laurel Ave. Lake Forest, IL 60045"Local restaurant open for brunch through dinner. If you\'re a tad tired of food that is complicated and gimmicky with a glut of exotic ingredients in miscellaneous combinations, plan an outing to the Grille on Laurel. Open since August 2004, the Lake Forest eatery is Kathy and Jim Govas\' newest baby, preceded by the late Noyes Street Cafe in Evanston and current culinary charmer, The Metropolitan Cafe in Highland Park. Chef Thomas Mini succeeds in serving simple cuisine with pure ingredients all in a casual yet stylish setting. An appetizer of grilled vegetables, for example, rubs shoulders with a simple but punchy balsamic glaze and creamy goat cheese. Fans of entree salads will like the impressive bunch here: Ahi tuna salad features the popular fish sesame-crusted and seared for a smoky charcoal finish yet succulent inside, with artichokes, black olives and chopped tomatoes peeking out from under. Among the half-dozen others, the sirloin salad, Caesar with grilled salmon and the Mandarin with grilled chicken, oranges, grapes, strawberries, walnuts and goat cheese don\'t disappoint. The Grille on Laurel excels with prime aged steaks and chops served with first-rate sides of grilled veggies, baked white or sweet potato, risotto or mac \'n\' cheese. Other tasty entrees include baby back ribs, grilled half chicken, sautéed red snapper and grilled grouper. Desserts are prepared in-house: toasted almond cheesecake and black and white chocolate cake will cure most anything. If not, there are 42 wines by the glass and weekend live entertainment to finish the job. -- Jacky Runice AOL City Guide

properties.name: The Weathervane Inn
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 4527 Dowling St. Montague, MI 49437White Lake\'s only luxury waterfront accommodation.

properties.name: Till Midnight Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks 171 East 24th st., Holland, MI 49423Upscale, funky, great food. Warm. Inviting. Inspired. till midnight restaurant has changed the rules on fine dining. till midnight\'s creative menu selections offers diners unique choices prepared with the finest ingredients. Paired with a selection from its award-winning wine list, till midnight has created a one-of-a-kind experience in a sophisticated, relaxed setting.

properties.name: Tree House Books
properties.description: Posted by Glbabooks    37 East 8th St. Holland, MI 49423. (616) 494-5085.Tree House Books is a 4,200 square foot general bookstore situated in downtown Holland, Michigan, on the Victorian-styled main street listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Tree House Books opened its doors in February 2003 with three goals in mind: to provide a haven of comfort for those browsers who love to peruse an eclectic bookshelf, to create a sense of community within its walls where ideas and knowledge are shared, and to establish the missing link of modern retail, connection with another human being. Tree House Books has a selection of over 12,000 adult and children\'s book titles, a wide selection of journals, stationary, greeting cards, gifts, toys, puzzles, and plush. Monthly events include story time, author signings, book clubs, poetry readings, character visits, and seminars. Owner Michele Lonergan provides outreach programs to schools and churches. She also appears on "Book Talk," on local radio promoting hot new reads. Tree House Books was recently awarded the designation of "Best Bookstore"Â in West Michigan by readers of Lake Magazine, a periodical covering the lakeshore from Chicago to Muskegon.
